intro: Scurrula rhopalocarpa, commonly known as the African velvet tree, is a small, deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically orange-red when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
